___no-new-symbol.description: Disallow new operators with the Symbol object

___no-prototype-builtins.description: Disallow calling some Object.prototype methods directly on objects

___no-invalid-regexp.description: Disallow invalid regular expression strings in RegExp constructors

___no-unsafe-negation.description: Disallow negating the left operand of relational operators

___no-inner-declarations.description: Disallow function or var declarations in nested blocks

___no-dupe-args.description: Disallow duplicate arguments in function definitions

___no-negated-in-lhs.description: Disallow negating the left operand in in expressions (deprecated)

___use-isnan.description: Require calls to isNaN() when checking for NaN

___no-unsafe-finally.description: Disallow control flow statements in finally blocks

___no-unreachable.description: Disallow unreachable code after return, throw, continue, and break statements

___no-control-regex.description: Disallow control characters in regular expressions

___no-regex-spaces.description: Disallow multiple spaces in regular expressions

___no-template-curly-in-string.description: Disallow template literal placeholder syntax in regular strings

___no-ex-assign.description: Disallow reassigning exceptions in catch clauses

___no-irregular-whitespace.description: Disallow irregular whitespace outside of strings and comments

___no-dupe-keys.description: Disallow duplicate keys in object literals

___no-obj-calls.description: Disallow calling global object properties as functions

___valid-typeof.description: Enforce comparing typeof expressions against valid strings

___no-cond-assign.description: Disallow assignment operators in conditional expressions

___no-empty-character-class.description: Disallow empty character classes in regular expressions

___no-self-assign.description: Disallow assignments where both sides are exactly the same

___no-else-return.description: Disallow else blocks after return statements in if statements

___no-return-assign.description: Disallow assignment operators in return statements

___consistent-return.description: Require return statements to either always or never specify values

___no-invalid-this.description: Disallow this keywords outside of classes or class-like objects

___complexity.description: Enforce a maximum cyclomatic complexity allowed in a program

___no-proto.description: Disallow the use of the __proto__ property

___require-await.description: Disallow async functions which have no await expression

___no-floating-decimal.description: Disallow leading or trailing decimal points in numeric literals

___no-new.description: Disallow new operators outside of assignments or comparisons

___no-loop-func.description: Disallow function declarations and expressions inside loop statements

___no-alert.description: Disallow the use of alert, confirm, and prompt

___guard-for-in.description: Require for-in loops to include an if statement

___no-warning-comments.description: Disallow specified warning terms in comments

___array-callback-return.description: Enforce return statements in callbacks of array methods

___no-eq-null.description: Disallow null comparisons without type-checking operators

___no-new-func.description: Disallow new operators with the Function object

___no-octal-escape.description: Disallow octal escape sequences in string literals

___dot-location.description: Enforce consistent newlines before and after dots

___wrap-iife.description: Require parentheses around immediate function invocations

___no-div-regex.description: Disallow division operators explicitly at the beginning of regular expressions

___no-implied-eval.description: Disallow the use of eval()-like methods

___accessor-pairs.description: Enforce getter and setter pairs in objects

___no-global-assign.description: Disallow assignments to native objects or read-only global variables

___no-useless-concat.description: Disallow unnecessary concatenation of literals or template literals

___no-self-compare.description: Disallow comparisons where both sides are exactly the same

___no-iterator.description: Disallow the use of the __iterator__ property

___no-new-wrappers.description: Disallow new operators with the String, Number, and Boolean objects

___no-implicit-globals.description: Disallow var and named function declarations in the global scope

___curly.description: Enforce consistent brace style for all control statements

___no-case-declarations.description: Disallow lexical declarations in case clauses

___block-scoped-var.description: Enforce the use of variables within the scope they are defined

___default-case.description: Require default cases in switch statements

___radix.description: Enforce the consistent use of the radix argument when using parseInt()

___vars-on-top.description: Require var declarations be placed at the top of their containing scope

___no-caller.description: Disallow the use of arguments.caller or arguments.callee

___strict.description: require or disallow strict mode directives

___no-undefined.description: Disallow the use of undefined as an identifier

___no-use-before-define.description: Disallow the use of variables before they are defined

___init-declarations.description: Require or disallow initialization in var declarations

___no-label-var.description: Disallow labels that share a name with a variable

___no-undef.description: Disallow the use of undeclared variables unless mentioned in /*global */ comments

___no-shadow-restricted-names.description: Disallow identifiers from shadowing restricted names

___no-catch-shadow.description: Disallow catch clause parameters from shadowing variables in the outer scope

___no-shadow.description: Disallow var declarations from shadowing variables in the outer scope

___no-mixed-requires.description: Disallow require calls to be mixed with regular var declarations

___no-new-require.description: Disallow new operators with calls to require

___global-require.description: Require require() calls to be placed at top-level module scope

___no-restricted-modules.description: Disallow specified modules when loaded by require

___array-bracket-spacing.description: Enforce consistent spacing inside array brackets

___max-params.description: Enforce a maximum number of parameters in function definitions

___capitalized-comments.description: Enforce or disallow capitalization of the first letter of a comment

___object-property-newline.description: Enforce placing object properties on separate lines

___one-var.description: Enforce variables to be declared either together or separately in functions

___newline-before-return.description: Require an empty line before return statements

___quote-props.description: Require quotes around object literal property names

___semi.description: Require or disallow semicolons instead of ASI

___object-curly-newline.description: Enforce consistent line breaks inside braces

___padded-blocks.description: Require or disallow padding within blocks

___newline-per-chained-call.description: Require a newline after each call in a method chain

___max-nested-callbacks.description: Enforce a maximum depth that callbacks can be nested

___max-depth.description: Enforce a maximum depth that blocks can be nested

___key-spacing.description: Enforce consistent spacing between keys and values in object literal properties

___id-length.description: Enforce minimum and maximum identifier lengths

___computed-property-spacing.description: Enforce consistent spacing inside computed property brackets

___block-spacing.description: Enforce consistent spacing inside single-line blocks

___no-lonely-if.description: Disallow if statements as the only statement in else blocks

___eol-last.description: Enforce at least one newline at the end of files

___func-call-spacing.description: Require or disallow spacing between function identifiers and their invocations

___sort-keys.description: Requires object keys to be sorted

___func-style.description: Enforce the consistent use of either function declarations or expressions

___consistent-this.description: Enforce consistent naming when capturing the current execution context

___operator-assignment.description: Require or disallow assignment operator shorthand where possible

___semi-spacing.description: Enforce consistent spacing before and after semicolons

___space-unary-ops.description: Enforce consistent spacing before or after unary operators

___unicode-bom.description: Require or disallow Unicode byte order mark (BOM)

___keyword-spacing.description: Enforce consistent spacing before and after keywords

___sort-vars.description: Require variables within the same declaration block to be sorted

___operator-linebreak.description: Enforce consistent linebreak style for operators

___max-statements-per-line.description: Enforce a maximum number of statements allowed per line

___one-var-declaration-per-line.description: Require or disallow newlines around var declarations

___no-trailing-spaces.description: Disallow trailing whitespace at the end of lines

___spaced-comment.description: Enforce consistent spacing after the // or /* in a comment

___id-match.description: Require identifiers to match a specified regular expression

___no-unneeded-ternary.description: Disallow ternary operators when simpler alternatives exist

___space-before-function-paren.description: Enforce consistent spacing before function definition opening parenthesis

___new-cap.description: Require constructor function names to begin with a capital letter

___multiline-ternary.description: Enforce newlines between operands of ternary expressions

___comma-spacing.description: Enforce consistent spacing before and after commas

___quotes.description: Enforce the consistent use of either backticks, double, or single quotes

___max-lines.description: Enforce a maximum number of lines per file

___new-parens.description: Require parentheses when invoking a constructor with no arguments

___newline-after-var.description: Require or disallow an empty line after var declarations

___func-names.description: Require or disallow named function expressions

___jsx-quotes.description: Enforce the consistent use of either double or single quotes in JSX attributes

___no-mixed-spaces-and-tabs.description: Disallow mixed spaces and tabs for indentation

___max-statements.description: Enforce a maximum number of statements allowed in function blocks

___brace-style.description: Enforce consistent brace style for blocks

___prefer-template.description: Require template literals instead of string concatenation

___no-useless-computed-key.description: Disallow unnecessary computed property keys in object literals

___generator-star-spacing.description: Enforce consistent spacing around * operators in generator functions

___prefer-const.description: Require const declarations for variables that are never reassigned after declared

___yield-star-spacing.description: Require or disallow spacing around the * in yield* expressions

___object-shorthand.description: Require or disallow method and property shorthand syntax for object literals

___no-var.description: Require let or const instead of var

___sort-imports.description: Enforce sorted import declarations within modules

___Require-yield.description: Require generator functions to contain yield

___arrow-parens.description: Require parentheses around arrow function arguments

___no-useless-rename.description: Disallow renaming import, export, and destructured assignments to the same name

___no-confusing-arrow.description: Disallow arrow functions where they could be confused with comparisons

___arrow-spacing.description: Enforce consistent spacing before and after the arrow in arrow functions

___template-curly-spacing.description: Require or disallow spacing around embedded expressions of template strings

___no-restricted-imports.description: Disallow specified modules when loaded by import

___arrow-body-style.description: Require braces around arrow function bodies

___prefer-rest-params.description: Require rest parameters instead of arguments

___no-this-before-super.description: Disallow this/super before calling super() in constructors

___rest-spread-spacing.description: Enforce spacing between rest and spread operators and their expressions

___no-new-symbol.description: Disallow new operators with the Symbol object

___rules.description: ESLint comes with a large number of rules. You can modify which rules your project uses either using configuration comments or configuration files.

___ignore.description: A list of file paths/globs that eslint should ignore

___settings.description: ESLint supports adding shared settings into configuration file. You can add settings object to ESLint configuration file and it will be supplied to every rule that will be executed. This may be useful if you are adding custom rules and want them to have access to the same information and be easily configurable.

___ecmaFeatures.description: By default, ESLint supports only ECMAScript 5 syntax. You can override that setting to enable support for ECMAScript 6 as well as JSX by using configuration settings.

___globalReturn.description: allow return statements in the global scope

___experimentalObjectRestSpread.description: Enables support for the experimental object rest/spread properties (IMPORTANT: This is an experimental feature that may change significantly in the future. It’s recommended that you do not write rules relying on this functionality unless you are willing to incur maintenance cost when it changes.)

___impliedStrict.description: enable global strict mode (if ecmaVersion is 5 or greater)

___extends.description: If you want to extend a specific configuration file, you can use the extends property and specify the path to the file. The path can be either relative or absolute.

___parserOptions.description: The JavaScript language options to be supported

$eref.description: By default, ESLint supports only ECMAScript 5 syntax. You can override that setting to enable support for ECMAScript 6 as well as JSX by using configuration settings.

___globalReturn.description: allow return statements in the global scope

___experimentalObjectRestSpread.description: Enables support for the experimental object rest/spread properties (IMPORTANT: This is an experimental feature that may change significantly in the future. It’s recommended that you do not write rules relying on this functionality unless you are willing to incur maintenance cost when it changes.)

___impliedStrict.description: enable global strict mode (if ecmaVersion is 5 or greater)

___ecmaVersion.description: Set to 3, 5 (default), 6, 7, or 8 to specify the version of ECMAScript you want to use. Alternatively, set to 2015 (same as 6), 2016 (same as 7), or 2017 (same as 8) to use year-based naming.

___sourceType.description: set to "script" (default) or "module" if your code is in ECMAScript modules

___globals.description: Set each global variable name equal to true to allow the variable to be overwritten or false to disallow overwriting.

___plugins.description: ESLint supports the use of third-party plugins. Before using the plugin, you have to install it using npm.

___env.description: An environment defines global variables that are predefined.

___jasmine.description: adds all of the Jasmine testing global variables for version 1.3 and 2.0

___commonjs.description: CommonJS global variables and CommonJS scoping (use this for browser-only code that uses Browserify/WebPack)

___mocha.description: adds all of the Mocha test global variables

___amd.description: defines require() and define() as global variables as per the amd spec

___es6.description: enable all ECMAScript 6 features except for modules

___shared-node-browser.description: Globals common to both Node and Browser

___node.description: Node.js global variables and Node.js scoping
